topic: Tuberculosis of Joints - Spine Hip Knee

basic_level.question: Which region of the spine is most commonly affected by tuberculosis?
basic_level.explanation: The thoracic spine is most commonly affected by tuberculosis (about 50% of cases), followed by the lumbar spine. This is due to the rich vascular supply and lymphatic drainage in this region.

basic_level.question: Which type of onset is most commonly observed in tuberculosis of the hip?
basic_level.explanation: Tuberculosis of the hip typically presents with an insidious onset characterized by gradually worsening pain, progressive limitation of movement, and muscle wasting over weeks to months.
